intro: Mallotus dispersus, commonly known as the hairy soursop, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, which resembles a small, spiky melon, is edible and has a sweet, tropical flavor. The leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name.
